abstract.text: We report the first detailed comparisons of the rates and spectra of neutral-current neutrino interactions at two widely separated locations.
A depletion in the rate at the far site would indicate mixing between and a sterile particle.
No anomalous depletion in the reconstructed energy spectrum is observed.

Assuming oscillations occur at a single mass-squared splitting, a fit to the neutral-and charged-current energy spectra limits the fraction of oscillating to a sterile neutrino to be below 0.68 at 90% confidence level.
A less stringent limit due to a possible contribution to the measured neutral-current event rate at the far site from e appearance at the current experimental limit is also presented.
